Raag Malaar − Part 001 1254 : 1 Raag Malaar, Chau−Padas, First Mehl, First House: 1254 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 1254 : 3 Eating, drinking, laughing and sleeping, the mortal forgets about dying. 1254 : 4 Forgetting his Lord and Master, the mortal is ruined, and his life is cursed. He cannot remain forever. ||1|| 1254 : 5 O mortal, meditate on the One Lord. 1254 : 6 You shall go to your true home with honor. ||1 Pause|| 1254 : 7 Those who serve You − what can they give You? They beg for and receive what cannot remain. 1254 : 8 You are the Great Giver of all souls; You are the Life within all living beings. ||2|| 1254 : 9 2

The Gurmukhs meditate, and receive the Ambrosial Nectar; thus they become pure. 1254 : 10 Day and night, chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord, O mortal. It makes the filthy immacuate. ||3|| 1254 : 11 As is the season, so is the comfort of the body, and so is the body itself. 1254 : 12 O Nanak, that season is beautiful; without the Name, what season is it? ||4||1|| 1254 : 13 Malaar, First Mehl: 1254 : 14 I offer prayers to my Beloved Guru, that He may unite me with my Husband Lord. 1254 : 15 I hear the thunder in the clouds, and my mind is cooled and soothed; imbued with the Love of my Dear Beloved, I sing His Glorious Praises. ||1|| 1254 : 16 The rain pours down, and my mind is drenched with His Love. 1254 : 17 The drop of Ambrosial Nectar pleases my heart; the Guru has fascinated my mind, which is drenched in the sublime essence of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1254 : 18 Raag Malaar − Part 001 3

With intuitive peace and poise, the soul−bride is loved by her Husband Lord; her mind is pleased and appeased by the Guru's Teachings. 1254 : 19 She is the happy soul−bride of her Husband Lord; her mind and body are filled with joy by His Love. ||2|| 1254 : 20 Discarding her demerits, she becomes detached; with the Lord as her Husband, her marriage is eternal. 1254 : 21 She never suffers separation or sorrow; her Lord God showers her with His Grace. ||3|| 1254 : 22 Her mind is steady and stable; she does not come and go in reincarnation. 1254 : 23 She takes the Shelter of the Perfect Guru. O Nanak, as Gurmukh, chant the Naam; you shall be accepted as the true soul−bride of the Lord. ||4||2|| 1254 : 24 Malaar, First Mehl: 1254 : 25 They pretend to understand the Truth, but they are not satisfied by the Naam; they waste their lives in egotism. −− Raag Malaar − Part 001 −− Raag Malaar − Part 001 4

Raag Malaar − Part 002 1255 : 26 Caught in slander and attachment to the wealth and women of others, they eat poison and suffer in pain. 1255 : 27 They think about the Shabad, but they are not released from their fear and fraud; the minds and mouths are filled with Maya, Maya. 1255 : 28 Loading the heavy and crushing load, they die, only to be reborn, and waste their lives again. ||1|| 1255 : 29 The Word of the Shabad is so very beautiful; it is pleasing to my mind. 1255 : 30 The mortal wanders lost in reincarnation, wearing various robes and clothes; when he is saved and protected by the Guru, then he finds the Truth. ||1||Pause|| 1255 : 31 He does not try to wash away his angry passions by bathing at sacred shrines. He does not love the Name of the Lord. 1255 : 32 He abandons and discards the priceless jewel, and he goes back from where he came. 1255 : 33 And so he becomes a maggot in manure, and in that, he is absorbed. 5

1255 : 34 The more he tastes, the more he is diseased; without the Guru, there is no peace and poise. ||2|| 1255 : 35 Focusing my awareness on selfless service, I joyfully sing His Praises. As Gurmukh, I contemplate spiritual wisdom. 1255 : 36 The seeker comes forth, and the debater dies down; I am a sacrifice, a sacrifice to the Guru, the Creator Lord. 1255 : 37 I am low and wretched, with shallow and false understanding; You embellish and exalt me through the Word of Your Shabad. 1255 : 38 And wherever there is self−realization, You are there; O True Lord Savior, You save us and carry us across. ||3|| 1255 : 39 Where should I sit to chant Your Praises; which of Your Infinite Praises should I chant? 1255 : 40 The Unknown cannot be known; O Inaccessible, Unborn Lord God, You are the Lord and Master of masters. 1255 : 41 How can I compare You to anyone else I see? All are beggars − You are the Great Giver. 1255 : 42 Raag Malaar − Part 002 6

Lacking devotion, Nanak looks to Your Door; please bless him with Your One Name, that he may enshrine it in his heart. ||4||3|| 1255 : 43 Malaar, First Mehl: 1255 : 44 The soul−bride who has not known delight with her Husband Lord, shall weep and wail with a wretched face. 1255 : 45 She becomes hopeless, caught in the noose of her own karma; without the Guru, she wanders deluded by doubt. ||1|| 1255 : 46 So rain down, O clouds. My Husband Lord has come home. 1255 : 47 I am a sacrifice to my Guru, who has led me to meet my Lord God. ||1||Pause|| 1255 : 48 My love, my Lord and Master is forever fresh; I am embellished with devotional worship night and day. 1255 : 49 I am liberated, gazing on the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan. Devotional worship has made me glorious and exalted throughout the ages. ||2|| 1255 : 50 I am Yours; the three worlds are Yours as well. You are mine, and I am Yours. 1255 : 51 Raag Malaar − Part 002 7

Meeting with the True Guru, I have found the Immaculate Lord; I shall not be consigned to this terrifying world−ocean ever again. ||3|| 1255 : 52 If the soul−bride is filled with delight on seeing her Husband Lord, then her decorations are true. 1255 : 53 With the Immaculate Celestial Lord, she becomes the truest of the true. Following the Guru's Teachings, she leans on the Support of the Naam. ||4|| 1255 : 54 She is liberated; the Guru has untied her bonds. Focusing her awareness on the Shabad, she attains honor. 1255 : 55 O Nanak, the Lord's Name is deep within her heart; as Gurmukh, she is united in His Union. ||5||4|| 1255 : 56 First Mehl, Malaar: 1255 : 57 Others' wives, others' wealth, greed, egotism, corruption and poison; 1255 : 58 evil passions, slander of others, sexual desire and anger − give up all these. ||1|| 1255 : 59 The Inaccessible, Infinite Lord is sitting in His Mansion. 1255 : 60 Raag Malaar − Part 002 8
That humble being, whose conduct is in harmony with the jewel of the Guru's Shabad, obtains the Ambrosial Nectar. ||1||Pause|| −− Raag Malaar − Part 002 −− Raag Malaar − Part 002 9

Raag Malaar − Part 003 1256 : 61 He sees pleasure and pain as both the same, along with good and bad in the world. 1256 : 62 Wisdom, understanding and awareness are found in the Name of the Lord. In the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, embrace love for the Guru. ||2|| 1256 : 63 Day and night, profit is obtained through the Lord's Name. The Guru, the Giver, has given this gift. 1256 : 64 That Sikh who becomes Gurmukh obtains it. The Creator blesses him with His Glance of Grace. ||3|| 1256 : 65 The body is a mansion, a temple, the home of the Lord; He has infused His Infinite Light into it. 1256 : 66 O Nanak, the Gurmukh is invited to the Mansion of the Lord's Presence; the Lord unites him in His Union. ||4||5|| 1256 : 67 Malaar, First Mehl, Second House: 1256 : 68 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 10

1256 : 69 Know that the creation was formed through air and water; 1256 : 70 have no doubt that the body was made through fire. 1256 : 71 And if you know where the soul comes from, 1256 : 72 you shall be known as a wise religious scholar. ||1|| 1256 : 73 Who can know the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe, O mother? 1256 : 74 Without seeing Him, we cannot say anything about Him. 1256 : 75 How can anyone speak and describe Him, O mother? ||1||Pause|| 1256 : 76 He is high above the sky, and beneath the nether worlds. 1256 : 77 How can I speak of Him? Let me understand. 1256 : 78 Who knows what sort of Name is chanted, in the heart, without the tongue? ||2|| Raag Malaar − Part 003 11

1256 : 79 Undoubtedly, words fail me. 1256 : 80 He alone understands, who is blessed. 1256 : 81 Day and night, deep within, he remains lovingly attuned to the Lord. 1256 : 82 He is the true person, who is merged in the True Lord. ||3|| 1256 : 83 If someone of high social standing becomes a selfless servant, 1256 : 84 then his praises cannot even be expressed. 1256 : 85 And if someone from a low social class becomes a selfless servant, 1256 : 86 O Nanak, he shall wear shoes of honor. ||4||1||6|| 1256 : 87 Malaar, First Mehl: 1256 : 88 The pain of separation − this is the hungry pain I feel. Raag Malaar − Part 003 12

1256 : 89 Another pain is the attack of the Messenger of Death. 1256 : 90 Another pain is the disease consuming my body. 1256 : 91 O foolish doctor, don't give me medicine. ||1|| 1256 : 92 O foolish doctor, don't give me medicine. 1256 : 93 The pain persists, and the body continues to suffer. 1256 : 94 Your medicine has no effect on me. ||1||Pause|| 1256 : 95 Forgetting his Lord and Master, the mortal enjoys sensual pleasures; 1256 : 96 then, disease rises up in his body. 1256 : 97 The blind mortal receives his punishment. 1256 : 98 O foolish doctor, don't give me medicine. ||2|| Raag Malaar − Part 003 13

1256 : 99 The value of sandalwood lies in its fragrance. 1256 : 100 The value of the human lasts only as long as the breath in the body. 1256 : 101 When the breath is taken away, the body crumbles into dust. 1256 : 102 After that, no one takes any food. ||3|| 1256 : 103 The mortal's body is golden, and the soul−swan is immaculate and pure, 1256 : 104 if even a tiny particle of the Immaculate Naam is within. 1256 : 105 All pain and disease are eradicated. 1256 : 106 O Nanak, the mortal is saved through the True Name. ||4||2||7|| 1256 : 107 Malaar, First Mehl: 1256 : 108 Pain is the poison. The Lord's Name is the antidote. Raag Malaar − Part 003 14
1256 : 109 Grind it up in the mortar of contentment, with the pestle of charitable giving. −− Raag Malaar − Part 003 −− Raag Malaar − Part 003 15

Raag Malaar − Part 004 1257 : 110 Take it each and every day, and your body shall not waste away. 1257 : 111 At the very last instant, you shall strike down the Messenger of Death. ||1|| 1257 : 112 So take such medicine, O fool, 1257 : 113 by which your corruption shall be taken away. ||1||Pause|| 1257 : 114 Power, wealth and youth are all just shadows, 1257 : 115 as are the vehicles you see moving around. 1257 : 116 Neither your body, nor your fame, nor your social status shall go along with you. 1257 : 117 In the next world it is day, while here, it is all night. ||2|| 1257 : 118 Let your taste for pleasures be the firewood, let your greed be the ghee, 16

1257 : 119 and your sexual desire and anger the cooking oil; burn them in the fire. 1257 : 120 Some make burnt offerings, hold sacred feasts, and read the Puraanas. 1257 : 121 Whatever pleases God is acceptable. ||3|| 1257 : 122 Intense meditation is the paper, and Your Name is the insignia. 1257 : 123 Those for whom this treasure is ordered, 1257 : 124 look wealthy when they reach their true home. 1257 : 125 O Nanak, blessed is that mother who gave birth to them. ||4||3||8|| 1257 : 126 Malaar, First Mehl: 1257 : 127 You wear white clothes, and speak sweet words. 1257 : 128 Your nose is sharp, and your eyes are black. Raag Malaar − Part 004 17

1257 : 129 Have you ever seen your Lord and Master, O sister? ||1|| 1257 : 130 O my All−powerful Lord and Master, by Your power, I fly and soar, and ascend to the heavens. 1257 : 131 I see Him in the water, on the land, in the mountains, on the river−banks, 1257 : 132 in all places and interspaces, O brother. ||2|| 1257 : 133 He fashioned the body, and gave it wings; 1257 : 134 He gave it great thirst and desire to fly. 1257 : 135 When He bestows His Glance of Grace, I am comforted and consoled. 1257 : 136 As He makes me see, so do I see, O brother. ||3|| 1257 : 137 Neither this body, nor its wings, shall go to the world hereafter. 1257 : 138 It is a fusion of air, water and fire. Raag Malaar − Part 004 18

1257 : 139 O Nanak, if it is in the mortal's karma, then he meditates on the Lord, with the Guru as his Spiritual Teacher. 1257 : 140 This body is absorbed in the Truth. ||4||4||9|| 1257 : 141 Malaar, Third Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 1257 : 142 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1257 : 143 The Formless Lord is formed by Himself. He Himself deludes in doubt. 1257 : 144 Creating the Creation, the Creator Himself beholds it; He enjoins us as He pleases. 1257 : 145 This is the true greatness of His servant, that he obeys the Hukam of the Lord's Command. ||1|| 1257 : 146 Only He Himself knows His Will. By Guru's Grace, it is grasped. 1257 : 147 When this play of Shiva and Shakti comes to his home, he remains dead while yet alive. ||1||Pause|| 1257 : 148 Raag Malaar − Part 004 19

They read the Vedas, and read them again, and engage in arguments about Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva. 1257 : 149 This three−phased Maya has deluded the whole world into cynicism about death and birth. 1257 : 150 By Guru's Grace, know the One Lord, and the anxiety of your mind will be allayed. ||2|| 1257 : 151 I am meek, foolish and thoughtless, but still, You take care of me. 1257 : 152 Please be kind to me, and make me the slave of Your slaves, so that I may serve You. 1257 : 153 Please bless me with the treasure of the One Name, that I may chant it, day and night. ||3|| 1257 : 154 Says Nanak, by Guru's Grace, understand. Hardly anyone considers this. 1257 : 155 Like foam bubbling up on the surface of the water, so is this world. −− Raag Malaar − Part 004 −− Raag Malaar − Part 004 20

Raag Malaar − Part 005 1258 : 156 It shall eventually merge back into that from which it came, and all its expanse shall be gone. ||4||1|| 1258 : 157 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1258 : 158 Those who realize the Hukam of the Lord's Command are united with Him; through the Word of His Shabad, their egotism is burnt away. 1258 : 159 They perform true devotional worship day and night; they remain lovingly attuned to the True Lord. 1258 : 160 They gaze on their True Lord forever, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, with loving ease. ||1|| 1258 : 161 O mortal, accept His Will and find peace. 1258 : 162 God is pleased by the Pleasure of His Own Will. Whomever He forgives, meets no obstacles on the way. ||1||Pause|| 1258 : 163 Under the influence of the three gunas, the three dispositions, the mind wanders everywhere, without love or devotion to the Lord. 21

1258 : 164 No one is ever saved or liberated, by doing deeds in ego. 1258 : 165 Whatever our Lord and Master wills, comes to pass. People wander according to their past actions. ||2|| 1258 : 166 Meeting with the True Guru, the mind is overpowered; the Lord's Name comes to abide in the mind. 1258 : 167 The value of such a person cannot be estimated; nothing at all can be said about him. 1258 : 168 He comes to dwell in the fourth state; he remains merged in the True Lord. ||3|| 1258 : 169 My Lord God is Inaccessible and Unfathomable. His value cannot be expressed. 1258 : 170 By Guru's Grace, he comes to understand, and live the Shabad. 1258 : 171 O Nanak, praise the Naam, the Name of the Lord, Har, Har; you shall be honored in the Court of the Lord. ||4||2|| 1258 : 172 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1258 : 173 Raag Malaar − Part 005 22

Rare is that person who, as Gurmukh, understands; the Lord has bestowed His Glance of Grace. 1258 : 174 There is no Giver except the Guru. He grants His Grace and forgives. 1258 : 175 Meeting the Guru, peace and tranquility well up; chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord, day and night. ||1|| 1258 : 176 O my mind, meditate on the Ambrosial Name of the Lord. 1258 : 177 Meeting with the True Guru and the Primal Being, the Name is obtained, and one remains forever absorbed in the Lord's Name. ||1||Pause|| 1258 : 178 The self−willed manmukhs are forever separated from the Lord; no one is with them. 1258 : 179 They are stricken with the great disease of egotism; they are hit on the head by the Messenger of Death. 1258 : 180 Those who follow the Guru's Teachings are never separated from the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation. They dwell on the Naam, night and day. ||2|| 1258 : 181 You are the One and Only Creator of all. You continually create, watch over and contemplate. Raag Malaar − Part 005 23

1258 : 182 Some are Gurmukh − You unite them with Yourself. You bless then with the treasure of devotion. 1258 : 183 You Yourself know everything. Unto whom should I complain? ||3|| 1258 : 184 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is Ambrosial Nectar. By the Lord's Grace, it is obtained. 1258 : 185 Chanting the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, night and day, the intuitive peace and poise of the Guru is obtained. 1258 : 186 O Nanak, the Naam is the greatest treasure. Focus your consciousness on the Naam. ||4||3|| 1258 : 187 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1258 : 188 I praise the Guru, the Giver of peace, forever. He truly is the Lord God. 1258 : 189 By Guru's Grace, I have obtained the supreme status. His glorious greatness is glorious! 1258 : 190 One who sings the Glorious Praises of the True Lord, merges in the True Lord. ||1|| 1258 : 191 Raag Malaar − Part 005 24

O mortal, contemplate the Guru's Word in your heart. 1258 : 192 Abandon your false family, poisonous egotism and desire; remember in your heart, that you will have to leave. ||1||Pause|| 1258 : 193 The True Guru is the Giver of the Lord's Name. There is no other giver at all. −− Raag Malaar − Part 005 −− Raag Malaar − Part 005 25

Raag Malaar − Part 006 1259 : 194 Bestowing the gift of the soul, He satisfies the mortal beings, and merges them in the True Name. 1259 : 195 Night and day, they ravish and enjoy the Lord within the heart; they are intuitively absorbed in Samaadhi. ||2|| 1259 : 196 The Shabad, the Word of the True Guru, has pierced my mind. The True Word of His Bani permeates my heart. 1259 : 197 My God is Unseen; He cannot be seen. The Gurmukh speaks the Unspoken. 1259 : 198 When the Giver of peace grants His Grace, the mortal being meditates on the Lord, the Life of the Universe. ||3|| 1259 : 199 He does not come and go in renicarnation any longer; the Gurmukh meditates intuitively. 1259 : 200 From the mind, the mind merges into our Lord and Master; the mind is absorbed into the Mind. 1259 : 201 In truth, the True Lord is pleased with truth; eradicate egotism from within yourself. ||4|| 26

1259 : 202 Our One and Only Lord and Master dwells within the mind; there is no other at all. 1259 : 203 The One Name is Sweet Ambrosial Nectar; it is Immaculate Truth in the world. 1259 : 204 O Nanak, the Name of God is obtained, by those who are so predestined. ||5||4|| 1259 : 205 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1259 : 206 All the heavenly heralds and celestial singers are saved through the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1259 : 207 They contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad. Subduing their ego, the Name abides in their minds; they keep the Lord enshrined in their hearts. 1259 : 208 He alone understands, whom the Lord causes to understand; the Lord unites him with Himself. 1259 : 209 Night and day, he sings the Word of the Shabad and the Guru's Bani; he remains lovingly attuned to the True Lord. ||1|| 1259 : 210 O my mind, each and every moment, dwell on the Naam. Raag Malaar − Part 006 27

1259 : 211 The Shabad is the Guru's Gift. It shall bring you lasting peace deep within; it shall always stand by you. ||1||Pause|| 1259 : 212 The self−willed manmukhs never give up their hypocrisy; in the love of duality, they suffer in pain. 1259 : 213 Forgetting the Naam, their minds are imbued with corruption. They waste away their lives uselessly. 1259 : 214 This opportunity shall not come into their hands again; night and day, they shall always regret and repent. 1259 : 215 They die and die again and again, only to be reborn, but they never understand. They rot away in manure. ||2|| 1259 : 216 The Gurmukhs are imbued with the Naam, and are saved; they contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 1259 : 217 Meditating on the Name of the Lord, they are Jivan−mukta, liberated while yet alive. They enshrine the Lord within their hearts. 1259 : 218 Their minds and bodies are immaculate, their intellect is immaculate and sublime. Their speech is sublime as well. 1259 : 219 Raag Malaar − Part 006 28

They realize the One Primal Being, the One Lord God. There is no other at all. ||3|| 1259 : 220 God Himself is the Doer, and He Himself is the Cause of causes. He Himself bestows His Glance of Grace. 1259 : 221 My mind and body are imbued with the Word of the Guru's Bani. My consciousness is immersed in His service. 1259 : 222 The Unseen and Inscrutable Lord dwells deep within. He is seen only by the Gurmukh. 1259 : 223 O Nanak, He gives to whomever He pleases. According to the Pleasure of His Will, He leads the mortals on. ||4||5|| 1259 : 224 Malaar, Third Mehl, Du−Tukas: 1259 : 225 Through the True Guru, the mortal obtains the special place, the Mansion of the Lord's Presence in his own home. 1259 : 226 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, his egotistical pride is dispelled. ||1|| 1259 : 227 Those who have the Naam inscribed on their foreheads, 1259 : 228 Raag Malaar − Part 006 29

meditate on the Naam night and day, forever and ever. They are honored in the True Court of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1259 : 229 From the True Guru, they learn the ways and means of the mind. Night and day, they focus their meditation on the Lord forever. −− Raag Malaar − Part 006 −− Raag Malaar − Part 006 30

Raag Malaar − Part 007 1260 : 230 Imbued with the Word of the Guru's Shabad, they remain forever detached. They are honored in the True Court of the Lord. ||2|| 1260 : 231 This mind plays, subject to the Lord's Will; in an instant, it wanders out in the ten directions and returns home again. 1260 : 232 When the True Lord God Himself bestows His Glance of Grace, then this mind is instantly brought under control by the Gurmukh. ||3|| 1260 : 233 The mortal comes to know the ways and means of the mind, realizing and contemplating the Shabad. 1260 : 234 O Nanak, meditate forever on the Naam, and cross over the terrifying world−ocean. ||4||6|| 1260 : 235 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1260 : 236 Soul, body and breath of life are all His; He is permeating and pervading each and every heart. 1260 : 237 Except the One Lord, I do not know any other at all. The True Guru has revealed this to me. ||1|| 31

1260 : 238 O my mind, remain lovingly attuned to the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1260 : 239 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, I meditate on the Lord, the Unseen, Unfathomable and Infinite Creator. ||1||Pause|| 1260 : 240 Mind and body are pleased, lovingly attuned to the One Lord, intuitively absorbed in peace and poise. 1260 : 241 By Guru's Grace, doubt and fear are dispelled, being lovingly attuned to the One Name. ||2|| 1260 : 242 When the mortal follows the Guru's Teachings, and lives the Truth, then he attains the state of emancipation. 1260 : 243 Among millions, how rare is that one who understands, and is lovingly attuned to the Name of the Lord. ||3|| 1260 : 244 Wherever I look, there I see the One. This understanding has come through the Guru's Teachings. 1260 : 245 I place my mind, body and breath of life in offering before Him; O Nanak, self−conceit is gone. ||4||7|| 1260 : 246 Raag Malaar − Part 007 32

Malaar, Third Mehl: 1260 : 247 My True Lord God, the Eradicator of suffering, is found through the Word of the Shabad. 1260 : 248 Imbued with devotional worship, the mortal remains forever detached. He is honored in the True Court of the Lord. ||1|| 1260 : 249 O mind, remain absorbed in the Mind. 1260 : 250 The mind of the Gurmukh is pleased with the Lord's Name, lovingly attuned to the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1260 : 251 My God is totally Inaccessible and Unfathomable; through the Guru's Teachings, He is understood. 1260 : 252 True self−discipline rests in singing the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises, lovingly attuned to the Lord. ||2|| 1260 : 253 He Himself is the Shabad, and He Himself is the True Teachings; He merges our light into the Light. 1260 : 254 The breath vibrates through this frail body; the Gurmukh obtains the ambrosial nectar. ||3|| 1260 : 255 Raag Malaar − Part 007 33

He Himself fashions, and He Himself links us to our tasks; the True Lord is pervading everywhere. 1260 : 256 O Nanak, without the Naam, the Name of the Lord, no one is anything. Through the Naam,we are blessed with glory. ||4||8|| 1260 : 257 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1260 : 258 The mortal is enticed by the poison of corruption, burdened with such a heavy load. 1260 : 259 The Lord has placed the magic spell of the Shabad into his mouth, and destroyed the poison of ego. ||1|| 1260 : 260 O mortal, egotism and attachment are such heavy loads of pain. 1260 : 261 This terrifying world−ocean cannot be crossed; through the Lord's Name, the Gurmukh crosses over to the other side. ||1||Pause|| 1260 : 262 Attachment to the three−phased show of Maya pervades all the created forms. 1260 : 263 In the Sat Sangat, the Society of the Saints, the state of supreme awareness is attained. The Merciful Lord carries us across. ||2|| 1260 : 264 Raag Malaar − Part 007 34
The smell of sandalwood is so sublime; its fragrance spreads out far and wide. −− Raag Malaar − Part 007 −− Raag Malaar − Part 007 35

Raag Malaar − Part 008 1261 : 265 The lifestyle of the Lord's humble servant is exalted and sublime. He spreads the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises throughout the world. ||3|| 1261 : 266 O my Lord and Master, please be merciful, merciful to me, that I may enshrine the Lord, Har, Har, Har, within my heart. 1261 : 267 Nanak has found the Perfect True Guru; in his mind, he chants the Name of the Lord. ||4||9|| 1261 : 268 Malaar, Third Mehl, Second House: 1261 : 269 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1261 : 270 Is this mind a householder, or is this mind a detached renunciate? 1261 : 271 Is this mind beyond social class, eternal and unchanging? 1261 : 272 Is this mind fickle, or is this mind detached? 1261 : 273 36

How has this mind been gripped by possessiveness? ||1|| 1261 : 274 O Pandit, O religious scholar, reflect on this in your mind. 1261 : 275 Why do you read so many other things, and carry such a heavy load? ||1||Pause|| 1261 : 276 The Creator has attached it to Maya and possessiveness. 1261 : 277 Enforcing His Order, He created the world. 1261 : 278 By Guru's Grace, understand this, O Siblings of Destiny. 1261 : 279 Remain forever in the Sanctuary of the Lord. ||2|| 1261 : 280 He alone is a Pandit, who sheds the load of the three qualities. 1261 : 281 Night and day, he chants the Name of the One Lord. 1261 : 282 He accepts the Teachings of the True Guru. 1261 : 283 Raag Malaar − Part 008 37

He offers his head to the True Guru. 1261 : 284 He remains forever unattached in the state of Nirvaanaa. 1261 : 285 Such a Pandit is accepted in the Court of the Lord. ||3|| 1261 : 286 He preaches that the One Lord is within all beings. 1261 : 287 As he sees the One Lord, he knows the One Lord. 1261 : 288 That person, whom the Lord forgives, is united with Him. 1261 : 289 He finds eternal peace, here and hereafter. ||4|| 1261 : 290 Says Nanak, what can anyone do? 1261 : 291 He alone is liberated, whom the Lord blesses with His Grace. 1261 : 292 Night and day, he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 1261 : 293 Raag Malaar − Part 008 38

Then, he no longer bothers with the proclamations of the Shaastras or the Vedas. ||5||1||10|| 1261 : 294 Malaar, Third Mehl: 1261 : 295 The self−willed manmukhs wander lost in reincarnation, confused and deluded by doubt. 1261 : 296 The Messenger of Death constantly beats them and disgraces them. 1261 : 297 Serving the True Guru, the mortal's subservience to Death is ended. 1261 : 298 He meets the Lord God, and enters the Mansion of His Presence. ||1|| 1261 : 299 O mortal, as Gurmukh, meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1261 : 300 In duality, you are ruining and wasting this priceless human life.
